intro: Piratinera potabilis, commonly known as the water-pot plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a velvety texture. It is adapted to grow in moist, well-drained soils and is often found near water sources.
